meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer here, and I'm about to dive into the world of Lego Marvel's Avengers. Now, I know what you're thinking - another Lego game, how exciting can it be? Well, let me tell you, this one's a wild ride!

First off, let's get the obvious out of the way: if you've played a Lego game in recent years, you know what to expect - more of the same old, familiar fun. But, hey, that's not all bad! The Avengers formula works just as well here as it did in previous games. Fast-paced, cheery, and full of humor, this game is perfect for young players (and let's be real, adults too).

Now, I know some critics might say that Lego Marvel's Avengers follows the old formula a bit too closely - that it's just more of the same. But, honestly, who doesn't love a good dose of familiarity? It's like your favorite pair of jeans - you know they're comfortable and will always fit just right.

Some critics (ahem, GameSpot) might say that the game is a bit stale, but I think that's just because they're expecting something entirely new. Newsflash: sometimes it's okay to stick with what works! And let me tell you, this game has plenty of moments where it shines. Like when you get to play as Stan Lee - priceless cameos all around!

So, should you play Lego Marvel's Avengers? Absolutely! It might not be a groundbreaking experience, but it's definitely fun and engaging. Plus, with an amazing amount of playable characters and a fun campaign, what more could you ask for?

All in all, I think this game is a must-play for any Marvel fan (or anyone looking for a light-hearted good time). So, suit up and get ready to join the Avengers - it's gonna be a wild ride!
